content:
• Monday, April 30, 2012
  • SBAC

    More on SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC): Q1 misses on a per share basis despite nearly a 15%...

    More on SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC): Q1 misses on a per share basis despite nearly a 15% jump in overall revenue. Site leasing revenue, which represents most of the company's operating profits, grew by over 18% Y/Y as the company benefitted from its recent acquisitions and the addition of new towers. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 PM
  • TXRH

    More on Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q1 easily beats estimates on higher revenue. Same store...

    More on Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q1 easily beats estimates on higher revenue. Same store sales grew by over 6% Y/Y, as the higher traffic numbers helped its bottom-line margins offset an increase in beef prices. Shares +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM
  • IDTI

    Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) acquires PLX Technology (NASDAQ:PLXT) for around...

    Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) acquires PLX Technology (NASDAQ:PLXT) for around $330M as the manufacturer of semiconductor products looks to enhance its product portfolio. PLXT shareholders will receive $3.50 in cash and 0.525 shares of IDTI for each share outstanding. That values PLXT at around $7 a share, a 76% premium to today's close. PLXT +65.7%, IDTI -6.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • MAS

    Masco (NYSE:MAS): Q1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $1.9B (+% Y/Y) beats by $70M....

    Masco (NYSE:MAS): Q1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $1.9B (+% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • FIRE

    More on Sourcefire's Q1: The Q1 beat was fueled by an 87% Y/Y increase in international sales to...

    More on Sourcefire's Q1: The Q1 beat was fueled by an 87% Y/Y increase in international sales to $15.7M. Sourcefire is guiding for Q2 revenue of $46.5M-$48.5M and EPS of $0.12-$0.14, compared with a consensus of $46.5M and $0.13. During its earnings call, the company guided for 2012 sales growth of 25%, above a 22% consensus. FIRE +6.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • FIRE

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE): Q1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $46.3M (+50.3% Y/Y) beats...

    Sourcefire (NASDAQ:FIRE): Q1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $46.3M (+50.3% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • PLXT

    PLX Technology (NASDAQ:PLXT): Q1 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $25.4M (-9.6% Y/Y)...

    PLX Technology (NASDAQ:PLXT): Q1 EPS of -$0.12 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $25.4M (-9.6% Y/Y) misses by $1.4M. Shares +69.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • PRXL

    PAREXEL International (NASDAQ:PRXL): FQ3 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $356M (+18.1%...

    PAREXEL International (NASDAQ:PRXL): FQ3 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $356M (+18.1% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • SFLY

    More on Shutterfly's Q1: Growth was driven by a 72% Y/Y increase in sales of personalized...

    More on Shutterfly's Q1: Growth was driven by a 72% Y/Y increase in sales of personalized products (77% of revenue) such as photo books and cards, offsetting weak consumer print sales. Shutterfly brand customers +18% Y/Y to 1.6M, average order value -8% to $24.60. The company expects Q2 revenue of $90M-$92M and 2012 revenue of $576M-$586M, above Street estimates of $88.4M and $556.3M. SFLY +10.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA): Q1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $151.7M (+21.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA): Q1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $151.7M (+21.8% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • MPWR

    Monolithic Power Systems (NASDAQ:MPWR): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $50.5M...

    Monolithic Power Systems (NASDAQ:MPWR): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $50.5M (+13.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.3M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • QNST

    QuinStreet (NASDAQ:QNST) -14% after reporting FQ3 EPS of $0.06, which may not be comparable to...

    QuinStreet (NASDAQ:QNST) -14% after reporting FQ3 EPS of $0.06, which may not be comparable to the $0.24 consensus because it includes an unexpected bad debt write-off of receivables due from an agency that became insolvent. Revenues fell 13.6% Y/Y to $93M vs. $102M consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • KONA

    Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $24.2M (+9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $24.2M (+9% Y/Y) beats by $1.1M. Shares +14.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • CLD

    San Diego County Cal Pension Oblig (NYSE:CLD): Q1 EPS of $0.47 in-line. Revenue of $372.9M...

    San Diego County Cal Pension Oblig (NYSE:CLD): Q1 EPS of $0.47 in-line. Revenue of $372.9M (+4.4% Y/Y) misses by $11M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • AEIS

    Advanced Energy Industries (NASDAQ:AEIS): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $105.8M...

    Advanced Energy Industries (NASDAQ:AEIS): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $105.8M (-23% Y/Y) beats by $5.8M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • EEP

    Enbridge Energy Partnership (NYSE:EEP): Q1 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $1.82B (-17%...

    Enbridge Energy Partnership (NYSE:EEP): Q1 EPS of $0.28 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $1.82B (-17% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • VECO

    More on Veeco's Q1: Though revenue fell 27% Q/Q, gross margin rose 340 bps to 46.7% and opex...

    More on Veeco's Q1: Though revenue fell 27% Q/Q, gross margin rose 340 bps to 46.7% and opex fell 13%, contributing to the strong EPS beat. Book-to-bill was a weak 0.81 thanks to poor LED and solar equipment orders, but that's up a bit from Q4's 0.75. Veeco is guiding for Q2 revenue of $120M-$145M and EPS of $0.29-$0.48, compared with a consensus of $128.2M and just $0.23. VECO +8.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • SHOR

    ShoreTel (NASDAQ:SHOR): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $56.3M (+59.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    ShoreTel (NASDAQ:SHOR): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $56.3M (+59.6% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY): Q1 EPS of -$0.29 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $91.3M (+59.6% Y/Y) beats...

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY): Q1 EPS of -$0.29 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $91.3M (+59.6% Y/Y) beats by $6.8M. Shares +5.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • WMS-OLD

    WMS Industries (NYSE:WMS-OLD): Q1 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $176M (-8.7% Y/Y)...

    WMS Industries (NYSE:WMS-OLD): Q1 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $176M (-8.7% Y/Y) misses by $14M. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST): FQ4 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $159M (-5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST): FQ4 EPS of $0.11 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $159M (-5% Y/Y) misses by $29M. Shares -7.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) has launched an $80/month prepaid plan featuring unlimited voice and...

    Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) has launched an $80/month prepaid plan featuring unlimited voice and text, and 1GB of data. That likely contributed to today's weakness in Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.9%), which stands in Verizon's crosshairs. Leap and fellow discount carrier MetroPCS (PCS +4.1%) were crushed on Thusrday after reporting major net add drops. Barclays predicts the nationwide giants will continue taking prepaid share.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO): Q1 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $140M (-45.1% Y/Y)...

    Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO): Q1 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $140M (-45.1% Y/Y) beats by $14M. Shares +9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • PMCS

    PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $132M (-16.1% Y/Y) misses...

    PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $132M (-16.1% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares -4.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • GRPN

    More on Groupon's (GRPN -10.6%) board shakeup: Schultz and Efrusy will be replaced by...

    More on Groupon's (GRPN -10.6%) board shakeup: Schultz and Efrusy will be replaced by "accounting types," a source claims. The move comes 6 days after Bloomberg reported Groupon wants to hire at least 2 new directors to restore investor confidence following its Q4 restatement, while suggesting the board would be expanded to make room. That's apparently not the case, and the Street isn't happy. Update: The new board members are AmEx CFO Daniel Henry and Deloitte vice chairman Robert Bass. GRPN +2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • KO

    Coca-Cola (KO -0.5%) releases a statement saying that it's not in talks to buy Monster Beverage...

    Coca-Cola (KO -0.5%) releases a statement saying that it's not in talks to buy Monster Beverage as reported by the WSJ. MNST -0.2% to $65.40 after hitting as high as $83.96 in intra-day trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 10 Comments
  • LDK

    In proof of how low solar industry expectations have become, LDK Solar (LDK +9.8%) is now up...

    In proof of how low solar industry expectations have become, LDK Solar (LDK +9.8%) is now up sharply after delivering a brutal Q4 report (I, II) and even worse Q1 guidance. Likely helping is LDK's disclosure it has cut 22% of its staff this year. In addition, LDK's guidance for 2012 revenue of $2B-$2.7B is largely above a $2.04B consensus, though many are doubtlessly skeptical it can hit that range.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • GRPN

    Howard Schultz and Kevin Efrusy are stepping down from the Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) board, reports...

    Howard Schultz and Kevin Efrusy are stepping down from the Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) board, reports AllThingsD, citing sources. Schultz's departure is to be immediate, while Efrusy will not stand for re-election in June. Shares -9.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • EMGC

    Shares of Imperial Holdings (IFT +31.2%) skyrocket after the provider of specialty finance...

    Shares of Imperial Holdings (IFT +31.2%) skyrocket after the provider of specialty finance services says it settled a U.S. government probe into its life-finance business, and that the only executive targeted in the investigation, COO Jonathan Neuman, has resigned.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • ARCB

    Several firms reduce their ratings on Arkansas Best (ABFS -5.4%) after weak Q1 results, released...

    Several firms reduce their ratings on Arkansas Best (ABFS -5.4%) after weak Q1 results, released Friday. BofA cuts shares to Underperform and its price target to $16 from $20, citing its larger-than-expected freight decline and its move to continue spending on investments, which "has us concerned about the pace of its rebound." Wells Fargo also slashes its rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • SUN

    Sunoco (SUN +19.6%) continues to lead all S&P gainers after its acquisition by Energy...

    Sunoco (SUN +19.6%) continues to lead all S&P gainers after its acquisition by Energy Transfer Partners (ETP +2.9%). ETP is most enamored with SUN's stakes in Sunoco Logistics (SXL -1.3%) and its network of refined product pipelines, terminals and trucks; ETP is paying plenty for the general partner interest in SXL, but it's a bargain vs. KMI's recent deal for EP.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • GNC

    JPMorgan calls today's weakness in GNC Holdings (GNC -4.4%) a "buying opportunity" after the FDA...

    JPMorgan calls today's weakness in GNC Holdings (GNC -4.4%) a "buying opportunity" after the FDA warns about the dangers of stimulant DMAA. Analysts with the firm note that DMAA only makes up only a mid-single-digit percentage of GNC sales and the company plans to continue selling products with it despite the brouhaha.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • CERN

    Cerner (CERN +4.7%) gains after Raymond James upped the shares to Outperform earlier today,...

    Cerner (CERN +4.7%) gains after Raymond James upped the shares to Outperform earlier today, saying its solid Q1 results demonstrated another period of strong new business trends. The firm also noted as a catalyst competitor Allscripts Healthcare (MDRX +4%) disappointing quarter and unanticipated organizational changes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • TFM

    Grocery stocks underperform the broad market after a report from the Commerce Department shows...

    Grocery stocks underperform the broad market after a report from the Commerce Department shows that consumers pared back spending compared to income in March. After catching a lot of M&A chatter earlier this year, the sector is starting to get downtrodden as the ability to pass off higher food and gas prices to thriftier U.S consumers doesn't look promising. Decliners: TFM -5.3%, SWY -2.3%, KR -0.8%, WFM -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • AWI

    Armstrong World Industries (AWI -5.3%) gets hit after missing on a disappointing Q1 result...

    Armstrong World Industries (AWI -5.3%) gets hit after missing on a disappointing Q1 result earlier today. Net earnings actualy rose 35% on fewer restructuring charges, but overall revenue declined on lower-than-expected sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH +6.4%) responds to recent allegations from Minnesota's Attorney General,...

    Accretive Health (AH +6.4%) responds to recent allegations from Minnesota's Attorney General, calling for the dismissal of the AG's complaint and saying the allegations are distorted, "factually baseless," and "legally indefensible."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • RAIL

    Shares of FreightCar America (RAIL -5.2%) trail off after UBS cuts its price target to $25 and...

    Shares of FreightCar America (RAIL -5.2%) trail off after UBS cuts its price target to $25 and trims 2012-2014 EPS estimates. Though the company has good backlog for 2012, analysts see lower coal demand pressuring new orders moving forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy (ENPH +6.7%) is started at Buy by Deutsche Bank, which says the developer of...

    Enphase Energy (ENPH +6.7%) is started at Buy by Deutsche Bank, which says the developer of microinverter systems for the solar industry is poised to benefit from the rapid growth of microinverters as the technology becomes mainstream due to superior advantages over traditional inverters. ENPH has a defensible technology position and a robust cost reduction roadmap, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • XSPA

    IP owner Vringo (VRNG +9.6%) jumps after hedge fund 18 Partners discloses it owns a 5.09% stake....

    IP owner Vringo (VRNG +9.6%) jumps after hedge fund 18 Partners discloses it owns a 5.09% stake. Shares have soared this month thanks to a positive TechCrunch article, and news that patent law opponent Mark Cuban has taken a 7.4% stake. Vringo is up 115% from its March 30 close.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • CHK

    ETF U.S. Natural Gas (UNG +3.6%) jumps as noted energy analyst Stephen Schork says he's...

    ETF U.S. Natural Gas (UNG +3.6%) jumps as noted energy analyst Stephen Schork says he's less bearish. A CFTC report showed Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) and ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP) are now net long on nat gas, which signals they're unwilling to sell future product at current price levels and would rather buy product in the future vs. produce it.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • CCE-OLD

    Coca-Cola Enteprises (CCE-OLD +3.1%) pushes higher in a heartbeat after a report tips off that...

    Coca-Cola Enteprises (CCE-OLD +3.1%) pushes higher in a heartbeat after a report tips off that Coca-Cola may snap up Monster Beverage. A deal, if struck, could help the bottler cut costs in distributing Monster products.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • EDS

    Shares of Exceed (EDS +74.4%) skyrocket after the company knocks out solid earnings numbers for...

    Shares of Exceed (EDS +74.4%) skyrocket after the company knocks out solid earnings numbers for 2011 in an audited report after accusations of fraud circled around the company last year. The Chinese sporting goods seller shows revenue of $522M and net profit of $74M on a market cap that still stands south of $100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT +1.2%) gains after being upgraded to Buy on valuation earlier today at Lazard...

    Medtronic (MDT +1.2%) gains after being upgraded to Buy on valuation earlier today at Lazard Capital, citing the company's new product growth potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • MNST

    Too much, too soon? Firstadopter sees the monster move in Monster Beverage (MNST +18.1%) as...

    Too much, too soon? Firstadopter sees the monster move in Monster Beverage (MNST +18.1%) as perhaps a bit hasty, noting that an article from the WSJ states that Coca-Cola (KO -0.8%) may ultimately decide the price tag is too high.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +6.5%) jumps on an upgrade to Market Perform on valuation at JMP...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +6.5%) jumps on an upgrade to Market Perform on valuation at JMP Securities, citing its emerging pipeline.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • HNHAF

    Hon Hai Precision (OTCPK:HNHAF), parent of top Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) contract manufacturer...

    Hon Hai Precision (OTCPK:HNHAF), parent of top Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) contract manufacturer Foxconn, fell 7% on the Taipei exchange after reporting Q1 net income fell 31% Y/Y to $510M, thanks to low margins and higher wages. The results stand in stark contrast to Apple's record FQ2 margins. Foxconn recently agreed to hike wages and change its labor practices following a critical report from the FLA. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform by BMO, which notes CHK has lagged other energy...

    Chesapeake (CHK +3.6%) is upgraded to Outperform by BMO, which notes CHK has lagged other energy stocks by at least 20% in the wake of the McClendon controversy. Yet CHK boasts "a a deep and wide asset base, and one that has fundamental value," and uncertainties around low natural gas prices and asset sales are now reflected in the stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • CPN

    Calpine (CPN +2.1%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy on valuation from Jefferies on the back...

    Calpine (CPN +2.1%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy on valuation from Jefferies on the back of last weeks encouraging Q1 report and increased guidance. The firm also raises its price target to $21.50 from $18.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • SVU

    Goldman analyst Stephen Grambling kicks Supervalu (SVU -3.75% to $5.91) while it's down,...

    Goldman analyst Stephen Grambling kicks Supervalu (SVU -3.75% to $5.91) while it's down, starting coverage of the struggling supermarket chain with a sell rating and giving it a 12-month target of $5. Grambling expects gross margin and free cash flow to remain under pressure, and that the company will struggle to grow volumes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (MNST +17%) soars after the WSJ reports Coca-Cola (KO -0.3%) is interested in...

    Monster Beverage (MNST +17%) soars after the WSJ reports Coca-Cola (KO -0.3%) is interested in buying the company, and could sell bottling assets to pay for the deal. Monster shares have been halted after hitting circuit breakers. Update (11:58 ET): Monster has resumed trading, and is now up 26.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • TESO

    Tesco (TESO +4.7%) says Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) will purchase its Casing and Drilling division...

    Tesco (TESO +4.7%) says Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) will purchase its Casing and Drilling division for $45M in cash, which Tesco says will allow it to "focus on delivering best-in-class service quality and return on capital employed."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR +3.3%) show strength and trace out an all-time high in front of the...

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR +3.3%) show strength and trace out an all-time high in front of the company's earnings report slated to be released tonight. The company has been so swamped with orders that it's stopped taking orders until the end of May.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 3 Comments
  • EGT

    Entertainment Gaming (EGT +12.1%) jumps higher again as shares have now more than doubled over...

    Entertainment Gaming (EGT +12.1%) jumps higher again as shares have now more than doubled over the last month. While Roberto Pedone has the stock lined up as a potential under-the-radar high-flyer, other traders warn that the new momo favorite isn't for the feint of heart.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • TEN

    Tenneco (TEN -9.4%) shares plunge after reporting a Q1 36% drop in net income, pulled down...

    Tenneco (TEN -9.4%) shares plunge after reporting a Q1 36% drop in net income, pulled down mostly by refinancing and bond retirement costs. TEN, which makes emission-control components and other automotive parts, had been posting soaring profit growth over the past year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • WCRX

    Canaccord says a takeout of Warner Chilcott (WCRX +17.6%) is unlikely, following reports that...

    Canaccord says a takeout of Warner Chilcott (WCRX +17.6%) is unlikely, following reports that the company is exploring strategic alternatives and speculation Bayer (BAYRY.PK -0.9%) is interested in acquiring the company. The firm sees the company as a value play with a number of alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • HOLX

    Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX) -9.8% following news it's to pay ~$3.7B for Gen-Probe (NASDAQ:GPRO), which...

    Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX) -9.8% following news it's to pay ~$3.7B for Gen-Probe (NASDAQ:GPRO), which skies 18.%. While Piper Jaffray's Bill Quirk says that "strategically, this makes all the sense in the world," Dougherty's Junaid Husain is very cautious. Because Gen-Probe is mature, "I am just not sure where they are going to get the accelerated growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (PAY -9.1%) gets clobbered after Deutsche Bank lines up a downgrade from Sell from...

    VeriFone (PAY -9.1%) gets clobbered after Deutsche Bank lines up a downgrade from Sell from Hold. An analyst with the firm sees the 11.8% organic growth rate the company claims as exaggerated by acquisitions and finds mobile payments presenting a significant risk to the VeriFone story.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • GNC

    Shares of GNC Holdings (GNC -5.6%) and Vitamin Shoppe (VSI -3.3%) slide after the FDA cracks...

    Shares of GNC Holdings (GNC -5.6%) and Vitamin Shoppe (VSI -3.3%) slide after the FDA cracks down on companies offering supplements containing the stimulant DMAA. The agency claims the ingredient increases the risk of higher blood pressure and could lead to possible cardiovascular events if overused.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • WCRX

    Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) shares +18.1% after the Irish drugmaker confirms speculation it's...

    Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) shares +18.1% after the Irish drugmaker confirms speculation it's in preliminary discussions with possible acquirers as part of a process "to explore a broad range of strategic alternatives to enhance shareholder value." (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • GT

    Goodyear (GT -3.4%) and Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB -2.6%) slump in tandem as a number of demand...

    Goodyear (GT -3.4%) and Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB -2.6%) slump in tandem as a number of demand factors weigh on the sector, including warm weather that diminished driver's needs for winter tires.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • ZAGG
